message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We analyze the relationship between climate change and crop yields in Africa, using data from the World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study — Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA) and the Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station data (CHIRPS).", "dataset": ["World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study - Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)", "Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station data (CHIRPS)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using a dataset from the World Trade Organization on bilateral trade flow and applied tariff data for 75 countries over 30 years, we investigate the impact of non-tariff measures (NTMs) on trade flows.", "dataset": ["World Trade Organization"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "This study examines the impact of school-based management interventions on primary school student learning outcomes, using data from the Philippine Informal Reading Inventory (Phil-IRI) and the National Achievement Test (NAT).", "dataset": ["Philippine Informal Reading Inventory (Phil-IRI)", "National Achievement Test (NAT)"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "We explore the impact of electricity access on household welfare using data from the Demographic and Health Survey (DHS) and the World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study (LSMS), both conducted in Nigeria.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Survey (DHS)", "World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study (LSMS)"], "topic": ["Energy", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "To investigate the relationship between social protection programs and job quality in emerging economies, we use a panel dataset of labor force surveys from seven countries, namely Colombia, Mexico, Peru, Brazil, South Africa, Turkey, and India.", "dataset": ["labor force surveys"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Social Protection"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze the effect of remittance on rural households' income and consumption in Nepal using data from the Nepal Living Standards Survey (NLSS) and the National Sample Census of Agriculture (NSCA).", "dataset": ["Nepal Living Standards Survey (NLSS)", "National Sample Census of Agriculture (NSCA)"], "topic": ["Migration", "Income"]}, {"sentence": "This paper examines the impact of infrastructure development on tourism demand using a panel dataset on 129 developing countries, taken from the World Bank's Infrastructure Database and the United Nations World Tourism Organization.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Infrastructure Database", "United Nations World Tourism Organization"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Tourism"]}, {"sentence": "To investigate the effect of financial sector development on economic growth in Africa, we use a panel dataset that includes indicators such as private sector credit to GDP ratio, stock market capitalization, and interest rate spread from the World Bank's Financial Sector Development Indicators and the International Monetary Fund's African Economic Outlook.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Financial Sector Development Indicators", "International Monetary Fund's African Economic Outlook"], "topic": ["Financial Sector", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We examine the role of governance and institutions in shaping forest cover change in Indonesia using district-level panel data from the Indonesian Ministry of Forestry and the World Bank Forests database.", "dataset": ["Indonesian Ministry of Forestry", "World Bank Forests database"], "topic": ["Environment", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "This study analyzes the relationship between socio-economic characteristics and health outcomes in Bangladesh using data from two waves of the Bangladesh Demographic and Health Survey (BDHS).", "dataset": ["Bangladesh Demographic and Health Survey (BDHS)"], "topic": ["Health", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}]
